input_text:
Job Title: Associate DevSecOps Engineer

Location: Los Angeles, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
LinQuest is seeking an Associate DevSecOps Engineer. US citizenship and the ability to obtain a DoD security clearance are required.

The Associate DevSecOps Engineer will work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment. Assist with architecture and build of custom software solutions while working with other developers and SMEs. Assist with breaking down complex problems into smaller, more manageable components. Assist with performing code reviews of others’ contributions and take ownership over the code base and integration with other systems.

Responsibilities

 Assist with monitoring and updating systems and software to eliminate vulnerabilities and exposures.Assist with scanning, testing, and hardening the security of software.Engage in self-study and training to stay current with emerging technologies and processes.Participate in sprint planning sessions, reviews, daily stand ups, and other agile collaboration activities with teammates, leadership, and product owners.Assist with project documentation.Support test and evaluation events.Assist with breaking down system/subsystem level problems methodically and into their components.Research and develop algorithms.Contribute to overall system design with architects.Assist with soliciting requirements or feedback from clients and/or product owners.Support the development and configuration of DevOps.Assist with designing APIs and other system interfaces.Assist with the scope of requirements and complexity of designs.

Required Knowledge, Skills, And Experience

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, software engineering, or related field0-3 years of experience in DevSecOpsExperience producing code in a team setting utilizing modern DevOps toolchains while following agile processes (this includes using Git for source control)Familiarity with containerization and container orchestrationFamiliarity with Kubernetes and DockerFamiliarity with load balancers, reverse proxies, and related tools at scale (Nginx/Envoy/etc)Familiarity with IAM, RBAC/ABAC, OIDC, and other AuthN/AuthZ methodsFamiliarity with architecting multi-stage CI/CD pipelines in Jenkins (or equivalent)Familiarity programming in multiple languages such as Python, JavaScript, Go, JavaFamiliarity working in Agile teams and associated tools (JIRA, etc.)Familiarity with logging and monitoring tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, Fluentd, ELKFamiliarity with IAC tools such as Ansible, Helm, Terraform/OpenTofu, PulumiFamiliarity with SQL, NoSQL, and graph databasesFamiliarity with file queues, DB clusters, and disaster recoveryFamiliarity with cloud-native products (Lambda/Firebase/etc)Familiarity with build and test tools of various languages (Maven/Composer/etc)Familiarity with service mesh and mTLS (Istio/Linkerd/Cilium/etc)Familiarity with Linux Administration across multiple distributionsPassion for solving problems and providing workable solutionsProficiency with standard computer applications and engineering toolsProblem-solving and critical thinking skillsMust have the ability to obtain and maintain a Secret Clearance by the federal government

Preferred Knowledge, Skills, And Experience

Proficiency in full stack developmentProficiency in High Availability (HA) systemsCybersecurity-related certification (CEH, SSCP, GCIH, OSCP, CKS)Familiarity with Department of Defense (DoD) security requirements for development, deployment, and operation of softwareFamiliarity with tools, environments, and processes leveraged within AF MS&A communityMathematics and StatisticsData Visualization DesignUI/UX Principles

Compensation: The salary for this position ranges from approximately $65,000 to $87,500 depending on relevant experience and qualifications.

Benefits

LinQuest offers comprehensive and competitive benefit offerings to our team members to include medical, dental, vision, retirement, paid time off, tuition reimbursement, company paid life insurance, and more! For additional information please visit: https://www.linquest.com/careers/our-benefits

Why LinQuest? 

LinQuest Corporation has a stellar 40-year track record of providing end-to-end system-of-systems (SoS) architecture definition, engineering design, integration and test, and operations expertise to enable full lifecycle development and deployment of pre-eminent Space, Air, Land, Sea, Ground, and Cyberspace game-changing capabilities across US DOD and IC Customers’ portfolios. Unique combination of in-depth domain knowledge, lessons learned-honed best practices, and mission-specific applications of principles, tools, and techniques of Digital Engineering (DE), DE Ecosystem (DEE), and Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) set LinQuest apart from the competition to consistently deliver stellar high-value results for our customers. LinQuest’s corporate vision and values place the employee at the center of utmost customer satisfaction, strategic business growth, and tactical execution excellence. Our employees’ creative and inspirational drive, sense of fulfillment of personal and professional growth, and tightknit camaraderie within and across lines of business are essential in gaining and maintaining exceptional LinQuest corporate-wide results of new business awards and renewed contracts.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
